channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the Company That Can Make Jet Fuel Out of Thin Air
item.description: From government contracts to consumer products, Airco shows how captured carbon can be put to work. The larger question is whether the sector can grow...

item.title: Fake Christmas tree prices are up, but Americans keep buying them. Here’s why
item.description: On a recent December day, Mark Latino and a handful of his workers spun sheets of vinyl into tinsel for Christmas tree branches. They worked on a cust...

item.title: Talking techie typeface with Fast Company’s creative director
item.description: What’s up, type nerds? Fast Company’s latest print issue features some of the brightest minds in AI , and creative director Mike Schnaidt wanted to ch...

item.title: An MIT roboticist who cofounded bankrupt Roomba maker iRobot says Elon Musk’s vision of humanoid robot assistants is ‘pure fantasy thinking’
item.description: Rodney Brooks said future “humanoid” robots will have wheels and multiple arms.

item.title: How Can I Stop People From Coming to Work Sick?
item.description: I don’t want them spreading their germs to others.

item.title: Unemployment hits 4-year high as frozen jobs data shows recession risks getting ‘uncomfortably high,’ top economist Mark Zandi says
item.description: Payroll growth for November came in at a modest 64,000. “There’s just no forward motion,” Moody’s chief economist told Fortune.

item.title: The Magnificent 7 Are Eating Each Other, but It Will Benefit the Rest of the Stock Market
item.description: Big Tech moats are shrinking as the AI spending race accelerates.

item.title: You can make up to $200K working in Trump’s new ‘Tech Force’—and you don’t need a degree or work experience
item.description: To be eligible for the two-year program, you only need "strong problem-solving abilities and a passion for public service."​

item.title: Trump White House says ballroom construction must continue for national security reasons
item.description: The Trump administration said in a court filing Monday that the president’s White House ballroom construction project must continue for unexplained na...

item.title: Beware These Retention and Recruitment Mistakes That Will Hurt Employee Engagement
item.description: Investing in your people is the highest and best use of any entrepreneur’s time and energy.

item.title: As the Powerball skyrockets to $1.25 million, a look at the 10 biggest U.S. jackpots ever won
item.description: The Powerball jackpot has grown to an estimated $1.25 billion for Wednesday night’s drawing after lottery officials said no ticket matched all six num...

item.title: Eggs recalled after Salmonella sickens 63 people in California: See the list of products and stores impacted
item.description: Vega Farms, a California-based food producer, has voluntarily recalled Vega Farms-branded in-shell eggs due to a Salmonella outbreak that has sickened...

item.title: Pepsi Layoffs: Here’s the Biggest Clue That Job Cuts Are Coming as PepsiCo Looks to ‘Right-Size’ Workforce
item.description: The reported layoffs could come as soon as this week, as employees have been asked to work from home, according to Bloomberg.

item.title: Government belatedly reveals loss of 105,000 jobs in October as full DOGE cutbacks come into view
item.description: Both the October and November job creation numbers, released Tuesday by the Labor Department, came in late because of the 43-day government shutdown.

item.title: Trump has ‘an alcoholic’s personality, chief of staff says in wide-ranging Vanity Fair interview. She calls it a ‘hit piece’
item.description: Susie Wiles also told Vanity Fair that she has read the Epstein file and that Trump is “not in the file doing anything awful.”
